title: Entrepreneurial Business Plan
xlist: Same As: MGT 618, section 01
description: 3 credits. This course is for six teams of five students each that want to write a business plan for their own real new start-up company. It runs October 20, 2014–February 23, 2015. Entrepreneurship is all about starting and running one's own business. In order to focus thinking and to help assemble the needed people and financial resources, many entrepreneurs write a business plan for their new venture. One of the best ways to learn how to write a business plan is to learn by doing—a real plan for a real new venture. Entrepreneurs should be confident self-starters and flexible thinkers, with a large capacity for work and the ability to take the initiative, overcome obstacles, make things happen, and get things done. They must be persistent and able to thrive in an unstructured environment. Students enter their plans in the Yale Venture Challenge contest sponsored by the Yale Entrepreneurial Society. The scope of the work includes doing in-depth market, product, and competitor research; creating a strategy for a sustainable business; and writing and presenting a professional-quality plan (including a financial model and deal structure). There will be an information session regarding the application process for this course on Monday, September 8, 11:45 a.m.–12:45 p.m., in Rm. 4430 in SOM's Evans Hall. Enrollment limited to thirty, by permission of the instructors.
